find the right verdict, their conviction is correct?



384
CHAPTER 17 ■Refutation
Theaetetus:Certainly.
Socrates:But if true belief and knowledge were the same thing, the best
of jurymen could never have a correct belief without knowledge. It
now appears that they must be different things.1
One thing to notice about this discussion is that Theaetetus does not dig in his
heels and insist that the ignorant members of the jury do know that the per-
